category: Member Sports Organization Regulations/Article 29 (General Meeting of City/Provincial Sports Organizations)
contents: Article 29 (General meeting of city/provincial sports organizations) ① The general meeting of city/provincial sports organizations shall be composed of the following representatives. Revised March 23, 2017, October 6, 1, 2021. Head of a city/county/district sports organization that has joined as a member of a city/provincial sports organization 2. Head of a city/province federation that is a member of a national federation ( (Limited to cases where the affiliated sports organizations of the (former) Korean Sports Council and the National Federation of Sports of the (former) National Sports Association of Korea are integrated into member sports organizations and their affiliated national federations.) ② The representative in paragraph 1 may attend the general meeting for unavoidable reasons. If it is impossible to attend, a representative may be appointed from among the vice presidents to attend. In this case, the representative's authority is the same as that of the representative only at the relevant general meeting. Newly established on March 23, 2017. ③ When it is difficult for city/provincial sports organizations to form a general meeting for reasons such as the number of delegates under paragraph 1 being less than 7 or the composition of delegates being concentrated in one field among professional sports and recreational sports, the city/provincial sports organization shall ·With the approval of the Provincial Sports Council, a general meeting can be formed including registered teams and sports enthusiast organizations (including sports clubs). Revised 2017. 3. 23. Moved from Paragraph 4, previous Paragraph 3 deleted 2017. 3. 23. ④ The head of a city/provincial sports organization is the head of a registered team, the head of a sports enthusiast organization, or his/her representative (teachers and leaders, A meeting of the general affairs manager of a sports enthusiast organization, etc.) is convened for each of the following groups and representatives are elected in accordance with paragraph 3. Revised 2017. 3. 23., 2021. 10. 6. 1. In the field of professional sports, representatives of the student department registration team and the general division registration team. 2. In the field of recreational sports, representatives of sports hobbyist organizations (including sports clubs) ⑤ Representatives under Paragraph 3 The number of athletes is determined based on the ratio of the number of registered players and sports enthusiasts, but prior approval must be obtained from the relevant city/provincial sports council. Revised March 23, 2017. ⑥ When the head of a city/provincial sports organization avoids convening a meeting under paragraphs 3 and 4, the city/provincial sports conference may be held with the written consent of more than one-third of the registered team and heads of sports enthusiast organizations. After approval, a meeting can be held and representatives can be elected. Revised 2017. 3. 23., 2021. 10. 6.
